required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow-up Study to Assess Durability of Sustained Virologic Response in Alisporivir-treated Hepatitis C Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-centre Long Term Follow-up Study to Assess the Durability of Sustained Virologic Response in Alisporivir-treated Chronic Hepatitis C Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to follow-up with participants from feeder studies who achieved sustained virologic response (SVR) over 24 hours posttreatment (SVR24), to assess durability of SVR, and to assess the changes in liver disease, development of hepatocellular carcinoma and post-treatment safety over time.
Participants enter this study from feeder studies CDEB025A2210 (NCT01183169), CDEB025A2301 (NCT01318694), and CDEB025A2211 (NCT01215643). They return to the site for up to 48 weeks with a maximum of 3 visits. No treatment is involved.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Load Below the Level of Quantification (LOQ) Through Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Normal Alanine-aminotransferase (ALT) Values at Week 48.
secondary_outcome.description: Note that the 24-week period between end of feeder study (SVR24) and first visit in this follow-up study is not counted in the 48 weeks, so this timepoint corresponds to 96 weeks (=24+24+48) after the last dose of alisporivir.

arm_group.description: All participants enrolled from CDEB025A2210 (n=164) who had been treated with alisporivir during the feeder study. There was no investigational treatment given to participants while enrolled in this follow-up study.

All participants enrolled from CDEB025A2301 (n=397) who had been treated with alisporivir during the feeder study. There was no investigational treatment given to participants while enrolled in this follow-up study.

All participants enrolled from CDEB025A2211 (n=162) who had been treated with alisporivir during the feeder study. There was no investigational treatment given to participants while enrolled in this follow-up study.

intervention.description: Intervention of interest; follow-up after ALV-active study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provides written informed consent before any assessment is performed
2. Is male or female aged ≥18
3. Has previously completed a Novartis-sponsored hepatitis C study and received alisporivir
4. Has achieved SVR24
5. Is able to comply with the visit schedule
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Use of any investigational drugs within 5 half-lives of enrollment, or within 30 days of that medication, whichever is longer.
2. Use or planned use to start a new course of hepatitis C therapy.
3. No additional exclusions are to be applied by the Investigator, in order to ensure that the study population is representative of all eligible patients.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 127 centers across 22 countries globally.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants transferring from Study 2211 were allocated to the "From Study 2211 group". These were evaluated as INF-free and Overall subgroups for efficacy analyses.

baseline.population: The Safety Set, defined as including all patients who had at least one safety observation (adverse event (AE), vital sign and/or laboratory assessment), unless excluded due to protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Load Below the Level of Quantification (LOQ) Through Week 48
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS), defined as all participants who enrolled into this study and had at least one HCV RNA assessment, unless excluded due to protocol deviations.

group.title: From Study 2210

group.title: From Study 2211 IFN-free
group.description: Participants enrolled from CDEB025A2211 (n=54) who had been treated with alisporivir in interferon-free (INF-free) regimens during the feeder study.

group.title: From Study 2211 Overall
group.description: All participants enrolled from CDEB025A2211 (n=162) who had been treated with alisporivir during the feeder study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Load Below the Level of Quantification (LOQ) Through Week 48
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS), defined as all participants who enrolled into this study and had at least one HCV RNA assessment, unless excluded due to protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Normal Alanine-aminotransferase (ALT) Values at Week 48.
outcome.description: Note that the 24-week period between end of feeder study (SVR24) and first visit in this follow-up study is not counted in the 48 weeks, so this timepoint corresponds to 96 weeks (=24+24+48) after the last dose of alisporivir.
outcome.population: Full analysis set. In the categories, n is the number of subjects in FAS in the appropriate study group with normal ALT at visit; for Overall - at all available visits.

reported_events.desc: Non-serious adverse events did not reach the 5% reporting threshold.
